contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''Volvo Baltic Race''' is a yacht race held in the [[Baltic Sea]], sponsored by [[Volvo]]. It has been held in 2003 and 2004 as training series for [[Volvo Ocean 60|VO60]] ships, targeting the [[Volvo Ocean Race]]. ==Volvo Baltic Race, for the SEB Trophy - 2004== Volvo Baltic Race, for the SEB Trophy is a three-week sprint version of Volvo Ocean Race. It will either be taking part in, or be in port at the same time, as three of Northern Europe's biggest events: Kiel Week, Germany, The Swedish Match Cup in Marstrand, Sweden, and the Accenture Gotland Runt. Initiator is Viamare, the Swedish yacht and hotel conglomerate. ==Legs 2004== 19/6 Inshore Race<br /> 20/6 Gothenburg - Copenhagen<br /> 23/6 Copenhagen - Kiel <br /> 25/6 W/L or Inshore Race <br /> 26/6 Kiel - Warnemünde - Sandhamn <br /> 1-2/7 Parade of Sail <br /> 4-6/7 Round Gotland Race <br /> 7/7 W/L Race ==Result== 1. Sony Ericsson - Thomas Blixt,KSSS<br /> 2. Team Elanders - Matthew Humphries, KSSS<br /> 3. Avant - Mikael Lundh, KSSS <br /> 4. JMS Next Generation - Kjell-Inge Heiberg, KNS<br /> 5. AV-Teknik - Marko Murtic, Croatia ==Volvo Baltic Race, for the SEB Trophy - 2003== {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} == Legs 2003 == 21/6 Leg 1 Eckenförde Race, 25 NM <br /> 22/6 Leg 2 WW/LW Kiel, 8 NM <br /> 23-26/6 Leg 3 Kiel-sandhamn, 470 NM <br /> 27/6 Parade of Sails Sandhamn <br /> 29/6-1/7 Leg 4 Accenture Gotland Runt, 340 NM <br /> 2/7 Leg 5 WW/LW Sandhamn, 8 NM <br /> 2-5/7 Leg 6 Sandhamn-Marstrand, 510 NM ==Result== 1. RS - Earl Williams, KSSS<br /> 2. Sony Ericsson - Thomas Blixt, KSSS<br /> 3. Challenge of Netsurvey - Matthew Humphries, KSSS<br /> 4. Elanders/Ten Celsius - Hans Wallén, GKSS<br /> 5. Nilörn - Frederik Frejme, KSSS <br /> 6. Atea Jan Mortensen, SGYF <br /> 7. Pontona Youth - Thomas Dahl Jensen, Aarhus YC ==See also== *[[Volvo Ocean Race]] [[Category:Yachting races]] [[Category:Sports competitions in Sweden]] [[Category:Volvo]] {{Race-sports-stub}}
